intro: Hieracium sericotrichum, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are hairy and often have a bluish or grayish hue, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium sericotrichum is an herbaceous perennial that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters.
